title: Paris 2024: Tourists more interested in Olympics than shopping
summary: The influx of tourists to Olympic Paris is not making its mark in department stores. Spectators' schedules are as tight as their shopping budgets.

title: The White House tried to get Navalny into Russia prisoners swap before he died
summary: On Thursday, Western prisoners – including journalist Evan Gershkovich – were flown to Turkey and then home. The Russian-chosen prisoners – including a hitman and accused deep-cover spies – were flown to Moscow.

title: Ismail Haniyeh's death: 'Negotiations for a ceasefire and the release of hostages are undermined'
summary: What are the consequences of Ismail Haniyeh's assassination for Hamas and the Middle East? Xavier Guignard, researcher at the independent research center Noria, answered readers' questions in a chat.

title: In Mali, Ukraine's shadow behind rebels at war with Wagner's Russian mercenaries
summary: According to corroborating sources, the Ukrainian authorities are collaborating with the pro-independence fighters operating in the north of the country, providing them with strategic information and training them in the use of drones.

title: French audit court criticizes Elysée spending on receptions and trips
summary: 'Significant efforts will have to be undertaken, starting in 2024, in order to restore and perpetuate balance,' warned the state auditors, calling out an €8.3 million deficit in the French presidency's budget.

title: Paris 2024 Swimming: US's Ledecky wins record 13th medal with a silver
summary: Katie Ledecky and her teammates took silver in the 4x200-meter freestyle relay, Thursday, trailing an Australian squad. No other American woman has more Olympic medals than Ledecky.

title: Journalist Evan Gershkovich among those released in US-Russia prisoner swap
summary: The journalist imprisoned in Russia for spying and a former marine Paul Whelan were released. The White House revealed attempts to negotiate the release of Alexei Navalny before he died in February.

title: Democrats start to vote to nominate Harris after Trump race remark outrage
summary: Less than two weeks after Biden ended his bid, no other Democrats have stepped forward to challenge Kamala Harris' elevation to the top of the ticket, making her nomination a formality.

title: Simone Biles reclaims all-around crown for sixth Olympic gold
summary: The American gymnastics star beat out Brazil's Rebeca Andrade to clinch her ninth Olympic medal and second gold in Paris. Defending Olympic champion Sunisa Lee, also of Team USA, took bronze.

title: Chariot racing in Rome, the forerunner of the sports industry
summary: In the capital of the Roman Empire, 150,000 spectators would flock to the Circus Maximus to watch chariot drivers from various factions, the first genuine star athletes of the ancient world.

title: Fear and mistrust in Hezbollah stronghold in southern Beirut after Israeli strike
summary: The attack, which killed the senior military leader of the Shiite movement Fouad Shukur, as well as five civilians, revived memories of the devastating bombings in the summer of 2006.

title: Iran and allies weigh retaliation after strikes in Tehran and Beirut
summary: The Islamic Republic says the Israeli state crossed a red line after it targeted Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh on Iranian territory. Without launching an open war, Iran wants to restore the balance of deterrence.

title: Olympics 2024: Composer Victor Le Masne says 'the rain was a key character in the ceremony'
summary: The musical director of the opening ceremony of the Games looks back on the preparations and inspirations for the event.

title: Olympic table tennis: France's unassuming Lebrun brothers are arousing unprecedented fervor
summary: The two French prodigies set the Arena Paris Sud on fire with every match they play. Their genuine sincerity pleases the public and attracts sponsors. On Friday, the younger Félix is scheduled to play in the semi-finals.

title: Paris 2024's unsung heroes: Jennifer Letort, the athletes' scissors
summary: In the heart of the Olympic Village, the young hairdresser, a world champion in team events, is taking care of the athletes' looks.

title: Mali separatists say they killed 84 fighters from Wagner Group and government
summary: Analysts said this was the heaviest loss suffered so far by Wagner in Africa.

title: Paris 2024: In Sao Paulo outskirts, Brazilian gymnastics revels in 'Rebeca Andrade effect'
summary: The double medalist's success at the 2021 Tokyo Olympics has sparked a passion for the discipline among young Brazilian women. In the place where the athlete made her first steps, female club memberships have skyrocketed.

title: Kamala Harris and the specter of Selina Meyer, the 'Veep' president-in-waiting
summary: Since Joe Biden announced his withdrawal, commentators and internet users have kept comparing the reality of the Kamala Harris candidacy with the fictional one conceived by Armando Iannucci and broadcast on the platform Max.

title: Hezbollah says fired 'dozens' of rockets at north Israel
summary: The group said the attack is 'in response' to a deadly Israeli strike in south Lebanon – the group's first attack after Israel killed a top commander earlier this week.

title: Venezuela: US recognizes opposition candidate González as the winner
summary: In a WSJ op-ed, opposition figure Machado, barred from running  said she is 'hiding, fearing for [her] life.' She said that the opposition has physical evidence that Maduro lost.

title: Olympics 2024: Following his slip in front of  Macron, diver Alexis Jandard bounces back
summary: An internet sensation when he tumbled during the inauguration of the Olympic Aquatic Center, the athlete competes on Friday in the 3 m synchronized event with Jules Bouyer.

title: Paris 2024: The Olympic Village cafeteria, not the 'world's greatest restaurant'
summary: The quality and quantity of meals served in the Olympic Village eatery have been questioned since the start of the Games. Sodexo defended its offer.

title: French judo legend Teddy Riner: 'I doubt myself all the time, doubt fuels me'
summary: Speaking to Le Monde, the French judoka looks ahead to the 24 hours during which he'll be aiming for a fourth Olympic title in Paris on Friday, from the night before his event to the potential joy after a successful final.

title: Colombian President Gustavo Petro: 'We call on the Venezuelan government to proceed with a transparent vote count'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the Colombian leader calls on the countries of the Global North to put an end to drug 'prohibition,' which he believes is having 'devastating effects in South America.'

title: Soldiers, civilians, elected representatives: Volodymyr Zelensky's daily meetings
summary: From factories to hospitals, on the front line as well as further back, the Ukrainian president crisscrosses the country every day, remaining at the political center of the country despite a decline in popularity. On Tuesday, Le Monde's correspondent accompanied him to northwestern Ukraine.

title: Biden, Harris greet US prisoners released in historic prisoner swap with Russia
summary: 'Wall Street Journal' reporter Evan Gershkovich and two other Americans were part of aa 24-person prisoner swap between Russia and the United States on Thursday.

title: Paris 2024's unsung heroes: Olivier Padovan, Olympic chef
summary: One of the pillars of the kitchens at Lenôtre, a subsidiary of Sodexo, is busy making sure that athletes and VIPs enjoy French cuisine.

title: Australia finds lethal Israeli strike on World Central Kitchen convoy result of 'serious failures'
summary: Seven members of World Central Kitchen were killed in Gaza on April 1. An Australian investigation says it was the result of Israeli failures including 'mistaken identification.'

title: Paris 2024: Laëtitia Guapo, French 3×3 basketball's shooting star: 'Every time, I push beyond my limits'
summary: The Les Bleues captain embodies a still little-known discipline that makes its second appearance on the Olympic program at the Place de la Concorde.

title: Exchange of prisoners between West and Russia is diplomatic success with bitter aftertaste
summary: Twenty-four people imprisoned in seven different countries, and two minors accompanying their parents, passed through Turkey's Ankara airport on Thursday, as part of the largest exchange ever organized since the fall of the Soviet Union.

title: Paris Olympics: Simone Biles wins second gymnastics gold under pressure from Rebeca Andrade
summary: The American athlete reclaimed her Olympic title in the individual all-around on Thursday, after a duel with Brazil's Rebeca Andrade. 'I've never had an athlete that close so it definitely put me on my toes and brought out the best athlete in me,' said Biles.

title: Le Monde's Paris Olympics guide. Day 8: Celebrating one week of the Games
summary: Need a hand navigating the Olympics? Whether you're in the French capital for the sport, the culture or the food, Le Monde's English edition has got you covered with a handy guide full of practical information and secret tips.

title: Paris Olympics: Forty-six-second fight swells controversy surrounding boxer Imane Khelif
summary: Italy's Angela Carini's withdrawal after facing off with the Algerian, disqualified from the 2023 World Championships on the grounds of 'competitive advantages,' has reignited the issue surrounding female athletes with high levels of testosterone.

title: Extreme monsoon rains wreak havoc in India and Pakistan
summary: Lahore, Pakistan's second most populous city, recorded record rainfall on Thursday. In India, torrential downpours flooded the roads of New Delhi, killing nine people.

title: Paris Olympics: Opening ceremony performers face 'quite terrifying' wave of hatred
summary: Drag queen Nicky Doll has in turn filed a complaint, this time against British activist Laurence Fox for defamation. The artists have also been getting a lot of positive feedback.

title: US election: Harris's entry into the race disrupts Trump's campaign strategy
summary: Since Joe Biden decided to forgo a second term in favor of his vice president, voting intentions between the two candidates have narrowed.

title: Battle rages over Venezuela's electoral system, the 'best in the world'
summary: The opposition and several foreign countries are calling for the publication of the minutes recorded in each polling station on the evening of the presidential election.

title: France calls on Russia to release 'arbitrarily detained' prisoners
summary: France saluted the prisoner swap between Russia and the West but called on its citizen Laurent Vinatier to also be released by Moscow.

title: France tells nationals visiting Iran to leave 'as soon as possible'
summary: The French foreign ministry said there was 'increased risk of a military escalation in the region.'

title: Paris Olympics: Andy Murray bids farewell to tennis in the men's doubles quarter-finals
summary: The most successful British player in tennis history retired following his defeat in the Olympic tournament on Thursday. Paired with Daniel Evans, the Scot was outclassed by Americans Tommy Paul and Taylor Fritz (6-2, 6-4).
